content: the deering pullover is constructed top down beginning with the cabled saddle shoulders the front and back are knitted flat with armhole shaping the pieces are joined in the round for the body the cable motifs begin slightly under the full bust shaping the body inwards to the waist hem no decreases needed lastly armbands and a thick cosy neckband are added **skill level ** intermediate pattern involves shortrows and cables **garment bust circumferences** sizes 1 2 3 4 5 \ 6 7 8 9\ centimetres 90 100 110 5 120 5 130 5 \ 141 151 161 171 5\ inches 35 5 39 25 43 5 47 5 51 5 \ 55 5 59 5 63 5 67 5\ the pullover is designed to have about 18 to 23 cm 7 to 9 inches of positive ease around the bust the sample shown was knit in size 2 modelled with 18 5 cm 7¼ inches of positive ease **suggested yarn** nirani luxe yarns yak silk dk 60% merino 20% yak 20% silk 212 meters / 100 grams sample is in emerald **yarn quantities** 510 550 630 680 730 \ 780 830 880 930\ metres 558 601 689 744 798 \ 853 908 962 1017\ yards **needles and gauge** 4 5 mm 24 or medium circumference circular needles for body 3 5 mm 24 or medium circumference circular needles for ribbing using 4 5 mm needles in stockinette 20 sts and 27 row = 10 cm by 10 cm swatch
